title: Reverting Git Commits: A Powerful Technique
description: Git is a powerful tool that allows developers to track changes to their codebase. One of the useful features of Git is the ability to rewind commits. This can be helpful when you need to undo changes or revert to a previous version of your code.

meta.title: Git Fundamentals | Rewind Commits
meta.description: Learn how to use Git to rewind commits and restore your codebase to a previous version. Explore the powerful features of Git for effective version control.
meta.keywords: Git, version control, rewind commits, undo changes, code restoration

verify.name: Verify Git Commit History Does Not Contain Added file2.txt
verify.hint: Please make sure you have completed the required actions.
